::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**SM1.1 Anchialine caves**](/efg-info/SM1_1.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/map-info/SM1_1_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: SM1.1.web.grid v3.0.

> Indicative distributions of Anchialine caves and pools were based on mapped areas of carbonate rock outcrop (Williams & Ting Fong 2016) and lava flows intersecting the coast, which were aggregated within a template of 1-degree grid cells.

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**Carbonate-rocks-3.0** (Williams P, Ting Fong Y  2016):

Source of _topography and geomorphology_.
 Resolution: variable (polygons), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: qualitative (experts judgement).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset             |url                                                                  |
|:-------------------|:--------------------------------------------------------------------|
|Carbonate-rocks-3.0 |<https://www.fos.auckland.ac.nz/our_research/karst/>{target='links'} |


:::
:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *Thresholds* :: *Clipping* :: *Reclassification*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Coarse quality map*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Indirect,general*.

Ground observations are _NA_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Qualitative expert assessment,qualitative (experts judgement)*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Indicative Map (**code: SM1.1.IM.grid**, version v3.0) 
 - Web navigation (**code: SM1.1.web.grid**, version v3.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**SM1.1.IM.grid** (v3.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/SM1.1.IM.grid_v3.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

**SM1.1.web.grid** (v3.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/SM1.1.web.grid_v3.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5091031){target="gisdata"} :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.SM1_1_web_grid){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

Datasets used to create this map might have some restriction for commercial use, see details below.


::: {.cell}
